description: Application for Minor Material Amendment (S.73) to vary condition 2 of planning permission ref: PP/2014/4426 dated 04/03/2015 (Phase 2)  and varied by ref: PP/2015/4717 dated 08/03/2016 for the Partial refurbishment, demolition and redevelopment of shopping centre to provide 4 storey residential accommodation fronting the burial ground and eastern perimeter of the site, together with 4 storey building on High Street with residential accommodation above a reconfigured High Street mall entrance and shops. Refurbishment of existing mall units, refurbishment and extension of two units to provide one 1,217 sqm class A1 retail unit and creation of a new 533sqm unit (A1/A2/A3/D2) above Belvedere Public House. Provision of 36 residential units, storage, plant, circulation space and amenity space; provision of 76 car parking spaces including 4 disabled spaces and 38 cycle parking spaces, with access from Churchfield Road. Provision of landscaped pedestrian link between the burial ground and High Street. The alterations to Phase 2 involve the subdivision of the largest retail unit into two units together with alterations to the layout of some of the other units
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun before the expiration of three (3) years from the date full planning permission PP/2014/4426 dated 04/03/2015.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
2. The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:

Application Boundary Plan, Site Topographical Survey, Proposed Demolition Plan,  3292_(PL)30B East West Elevations, 3292_(PL) 31B North & South Sectional Elevations, 3292_(PL)32A High Street Elevation & Mall Section, 3292_(PL)33A Block D Elevations, 3292_(PL)34B Block B west and Block D north elevations; 3292_(PL)40C Lower Ground Floor Plan; 3292_(PL)41C ground floor plan; 3292_(PL)42A First floor plan; 3292_(PL)43A Second floor plan; 3292_(PL)44A Third floor/roof plan;  3292_(PL)45D Lower Ground Floor Plan; 3292_(PL)46D Ground Floor Plan; 3292_(PL)47B First Floor Plan; 3292_(PL)48B Second Floor Plan; 3292_(PL)49A Roof Plan, 3292_(PL)50D East & West Sectional Elevations, 3292_(PL)51E North & South Sectional Elevations, 3292_(PL)52A High Street Elevation & Mall Sections, LO319_L01A Lower Ground Floor Landscape, LO319_L02A Ground Floor Landscape, LO319_L03A First floor landscape.
Planning Statement by Maddox Associates;
Design and Access Statement by Stock Woolstencroft;
Heritage Statement and Visual Impact Assessment by Maddox Associates/Stock Woolstencroft;
Historic Environment Assessment (Archaeology) by Museum of London;
Transport Statement by Cambria Consulting;
Travel Plan (draft) by Cambria Consulting;
Economic and Social Impact Statement by Regeneris;
Energy Statement (including CfSH and BREEAM Assessments) by ABBA;
Flood Risk Assessment by Cambria Consulting;
Sustainability Checklist by ABBA Energy;
Daylight and Sunlight Report by GVASB;
Ventilation Statement by Royston Jones;
Wind and Microclimate Assessment by RWDI;
Construction Method Statement by Goddard & Sons;
Retail Assessment by Maddox Associates;
Statement of Community Engagement;
Transport Statement Addendum by Cambria Consulting July 2017;
Planning Design and Access Statement by Maven Plan July 2017
Commercial Plant Strategy Clarification by Mendick Waring Ltd September 2017

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning to ensure that the development is implemented in accordance with the approved plans, which have been, assessed against the Council's Adopted Development Plan.

3. Before work is commenced on the relevant element of the scheme to which these conditions refer, details (including samples where appropriate) of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development; other than details of the brickwork approved under planning permission reference 171297CND dated 25/05/2017 and details of windows, window treatment, metal, cement, render facing and banding details approved under permission reference 173143REM dated 25/08/2017, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
The samples and details shall include:
a) cladding and colours;
b) re-constituted stone;
c) balcony structures and balustrading treatment (including sections);
d) privacy screens;
e) ventilation and extraction louvres;
f) shop fronts: and
g) all other external materials to be used.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 1.1(h) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

4. Prior to the first occupation of the development details of external lighting of the buildings, communal amenity areas and areas of public realm within the site together with associated mitigation measures to control light spillage, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and implemented as approved and retained thereafter for the life of the development.

Reason: To provide a safe and secure external environment for occupants and users of the development and surrounding open spaces in accordance with policy 7.3 of the London Plan 2016, policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013; policy 1.1(h),of the Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and Ealing Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) Note 8: Safer Ealing.

5. The external lighting schemes shall comply with the advice given at BS 5389 with regards to upward light and light pollution and lighting of public amenity areas and relevant ILE and CIBSE guidance on the reduction of obtrusive lighting.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and with policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013; and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
6. The replacement boundary enclosure with St Mary's Burial Ground shall be in accordance with the details approved under permission reference 171763CND dated 10/08/2017.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained for the lifetime of the development. This condition applies, notwithstanding the information contained within the submitted Application.

Reason: To preserve the special architectural and historic interest of the adjoining burial ground which lies within the Acton Town Conservation Area in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.6, 7.8 and 7.9 of the adopted London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(h), 1.2g) and 2.1(c) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012) and policies 7A, 7B, 7C and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

7. Prior to first occupation of any of the dwellings hereby approved details of the children's play areas (including play equipment, landscaping, boundary treatment, disabled access and security measures) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented and completed as approved prior to first occupation of the relevant part of the residential development that the facilities serve and retained for the life of the development unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that adequate on-site space for young children to play is provided on site in connection with the proposed residential accommodation, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.6, 5.3 and 7.2 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e) and (i), 1.2 (d), 5.5, 6.2 & 6.3 of the Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.

8. Prior to the first occupation of any non-residential parts of the development, an overall management strategy for the whole of the site (including the approved Phase 1) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
The strategy should include details of the following:
- Security Strategy
- to include design, location and details of CCTV and associated equipment, security lighting, design, entry systems and post boxes
- Disabled access Strategy
- Deliveries and Servicing Strategy
- Refuse and Recycling Collection Strategy
- Parking Strategy to include measures to prevent parking in undesignated areas and details of the parking available for each proposed and existing building.
The site shall be managed in accordance with the approved strategy for the life of the development, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interests of the proper maintenance, safety and security of the site and to ensure that the quality of the public realm and the setting of the listed buildings is appropriately safeguarded and that that access is maintained for disabled people and people with pushchairs, in accordance with policies 3.1, 3.16, 7.2, 7.3, 7.5 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2016, Policies 1.1(e), (g) and (h),1.2 (d) and (f), and 2.10 of the Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7A, 7B and 7C of Ealing Development Management Plan Document 2013 and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 7 'Accessible Ealing'.

9. The drainage works shall  be undertaken in accordance with the Drainage Strategy approved under permission reference 162825CND dated 22/12/2016. No discharge of foul or surface water from the site shall be accepted into the public system until the drainage works referred to in the strategy have been completed.

Reason: To ensure that a sufficient capacity is made available to cope with the new development; and in order to avoid adverse environmental conditions impact in accordance with Policy 5.13 of the London Plan 2016, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(m) of the Development (or Core) Strategy 2012.

10. The drainage works shall be undertaken in accordance with the details of the water storage approved under permission reference 163172CND dated 22/12/2016. The details shall be implemented fully in accordance with the approved scheme prior to first occupation of the development unless an alternative timescale is agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that a sustainable drainage system is provided for the site accordance with Policy 5.13 of the London Plan 2016, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(m) of the Development (or Core) Strategy 2012.
11. The impact study into the existing water supply shall be in accordance with the details approved under application reference PP/2015/3827 dated 08/01/2016.

Reason: The ensure the water supply infrastructure has sufficient capacity to meet the additional demands of the proposed development in accordance with policy 5.15 of the London Plan 2016, and policies 1.2(d) and 6.1 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012.

12. The procurement of materials for the development shall be undertaken in accordance with the Site Waste Management Plan and Green Procurement Plan approved under permission reference PP/2015/4567 dated 08/01/2016.
The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the particulars so approved.

Reason: To ensure sustainable procurement of materials which minimises the negative environmental impacts of construction in accordance with policies 5.3 and 5.18 of the London Plan 2016, and policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012.

13. The insulation of the floor/ceiling separating the commercial premises and the internal car park from the upper floor dwellings shall be in accordance with the details approved under application reference 161030REM dated 19/07/2016

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, and policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
14. Deliveries and waste collections at the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0600 - 2300 hours on Mondays to Saturdays and during the period 0800 - 2000 hours on Sundays.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development and occupiers of surrounding properties against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document 2013.
15. No part of the proposed balconies or terraces within the development shall be used as storage areas or areas for the hanging or drying of washing at any time.

Reason: To protect the appearance and character of the area, in accordance with policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document 2013.
16.  Tree protection measures shall be in accordance with the details approved under permission reference PP/2015/4568 dated 08/01/2016.
No development or other operations shall take place except in complete accordance with the approved protection scheme.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall be in place prior to the commencement of development and not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.
The land within the tree protection areas shall not be altered or used for any purpose in conjunction with the approved development.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policy 7.21 of the London Plan 2016, policy 1.1(i) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidance'.

17. A detailed scheme of proposed hard and soft landscaping including tree planting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority at least 6 months prior to any occupation of the development. The details as approved shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the commencement of the development or such other period as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season. This hard and soft landscaping shall be subject to a landscape management plan, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the development. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained and managed in accordance with the approved landscape management programme.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, 7.8 & 7.21 of the London Plan 2016, polices 1.2 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and, policies 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7C & 7D of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013.
18. The proposed extract ventilation systems for the proposed car park, shall be carried out in accordance with the details approved under application reference 161460REM dated 22/12/2016

Reason: To safeguard the amenity of future residents, in accordance with policies 7.14 and 7.15 of the adopted London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e) and 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and the Council's Supplementary Planning Guidance 3 'Air Quality and Pollution (draft) and adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance10 'Noise and Vibration'.

19. A Site Wide Car and Cycle Parking Management Strategy (in keeping with the draft Travel Plan) shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority at least 6 months prior to occupation of any part of the development.
The Site Wide Car and Cycle Parking Management Strategy shall outline for each stage of the development:
a)	The proposed distribution, phasing, accumulation of and arrangements for the management of:
i) Visitor car parking
ii) Residential car parking
iii) Commercial car parking
iv) Motorcycle spaces
v) Wheelchair users parking
vi) Car club space
b) Measures for preventing parking in undesignated places throughout the site

c) Within the development; the provision of active Electric Vehicle Charging Points (EVCP) for a minimum of 20% of the residential car parking spaces with an additional 20% passive; a minimum of 10% of the retail car parking spaces with an additional 10% passive; as set out in the London Plan 2016;
d) The safety and security measures to be incorporated within the development to ensure the safety of car/cycle parking areas

e) Details including location, and where appropriate the design and appearance of the cycle parking for the internal and external storage for 314 cycles. The car and cycle parking shall be provided and managed in accordance with the approved strategy for the life of the development, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure inclusive, safe and adequate parking is provided and retained in conjunction with the development in the interests of the general amenities of the locality, the flow of traffic and conditions of pedestrian and general highway safety within the site and on neighbouring highways, a sustainable development and where appropriate constrain local highway impact in accordance with policies 6.3, 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016; and policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) 1.1(g) and 1.1(h) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012.

20. Prior to occupation of the development, a draft Travel Plan for the comprehensive development of the Oaks site including the approved Phase 1 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. As part of the Travel Plan measures, details of an appointed car club vehicle provider and details of the siting of the car club spaces and terms for car club hire will be given.

Prior to the first occupation of the development a final detailed Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Car club vehicles shall be provided in accordance with the approved details if such provision is found to be viable. The final Travel Plan shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any part of the development.

Reason: In the interest of supporting measures that encourage shifts to more sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies 6.1 and 6.3 of the London Plan 2016; policies 1.1(f), 1.1(g), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(k) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and SPG 21: Sustainable Transport - Green Travel Plans.

21. The proposed new North/South pedestrian walkway linking Churchfield Road with High Street shall be carried out in accordance with the details approved under permission reference 165548CND dated 25/05/2017.

The pedestrian link shall be constructed and available for the public to use in accordance with details approved prior to the occupation of any of the residential units on the Phase 2 site of the development, and thereafter retained for the lifetime of the development.
22. In regard to contamination, the development must be in accordance with The Oaks Site 'Remediation Strategy' approved under permission reference: 161101REM dated 20/07/2016.

Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous in the interest of public health and safety, in accordance with policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2016, policy 1.1(e), of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and policy 2LV 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document 2013.
23. The development must be in accordance with The Oaks Site 'Remediation Strategy' approved under permission reference 161101REM dated 20/07/2016.
It must be ensured that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.

Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous in the interest of public health and safety, in accordance with policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2016, policy 1.1(e), of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and policy 2LV 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document 2013.

24. No remediation shall be carried out other than in accordance with the remediation scheme approved under condition 23. Should any remediation be planned to be carried out the Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.

Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous in the interest of public health and safety, in accordance with policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2016, policy 1.1(e), of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and policy 2LV 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document 2013.

25. Each new build dwelling hereby permitted shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4 in accordance with the details included in the Interim Code for Sustainable Homes Assessment and Building Research Establishment (BRE) Certificate approved under application reference 172287CND dated 29/06/2017.

The Post Construction Certificate verified by the BRE for each dwelling shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been implemented within three months of that dwelling's first occupation.

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the CfSH Level 4 shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.

Reason: To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policy 5.2G of Ealing Development Management DPD (10th December 2013), Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016.

26. Each non-residential building hereby permitted shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Very Good standard (based on BREEAM 2011 Technical Guidance) in accordance with the details included in the Interim BREEAM 2011 NC Assessments Certificates verified by the BRE approved under application reference 174196CND dated 16/10/2017

Within 6 months from the date of first occupation of each non-residential element of the development a BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and Certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval, confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been achieved.

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificates of each element of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.

Reason: In the interests of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016 and policies 1.1(k) and 1.23(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012.
27. Before any work is commenced on that relevant aspect of the scheme, and notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, full details of the ground floor elevations including:
a) Residential entrances;
b) Commercial entrances;
c) Shop fronts; and
d) Service/car park entrances.

Shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority on that relevant aspect of the scheme. The details shall include: doors, sections, elevational and threshold treatments, all to be shown in context and to a scale of 1:50.

The ground floor elevations shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the details so approved, maintained as such thereafter and no change shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the Authority may be satisfied with the access arrangements and the street level external appearance / interface of the buildings in accordance with policies; 7.1, 7.2, of the London Plan 2016, Policy 1.2 of the Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and policies 7.3 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan document 2013.

28. Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on that relevant aspect of the scheme, to demonstrate that the recommendations with regard to Car Park Illumination, made by the Institute of Lighting Engineers Technical Report, Guidance Notes on the Reduction of Light Pollution and also the provisions at BS5489, Part 9 will be met. The internal car parking lighting shall provide no less than 30 lux when measured at ground level.

Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced to demonstrate that the proposed lighting scheme will confirm to the advice given at BS5489 Part 3 Code for Practice for Lighting for Subsidiary Roads and Associated Pedestrian Areas. The details shall include information to demonstrate that the potential for nuisance from glare and illuminance will be reduced by correctly aiming and shielding the luminaires to control vertical illuminance with the lights operating at any affected facade.

Reason: To secure a safe and secure basement environment for users of the building in accordance with policy 1.1(e) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and Ealing Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) Note 8: Safer Ealing.

29. Before the reconfigured car park is brought back into use details of the design of the car parking areas, including the angles of any ramps, vehicle platforms at the ends of the ramps, sightlines, headroom, access control, siting of columns and general layout shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason : In the interests of pedestrian and general highway safety and the free flow of traffic on the neighbouring highways in accordance with policies 1.1(e) and (f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012.

30. The (Phase 2) development hereby approved shall only be carried out in conjunction with the Phase 1 development approved on the 8th April 2014 (Ref: P/2012/3385). The phasing plan showing how the development (phases 1 and 2) will be implemented in a comprehensive manner shall be in accordance with the details approved under permission reference PP/2015/4569 dated 08/01/2016. The development shall then be implemented only in accordance with the approved phasing plan.
Reason: To ensure that the development is implemented in a comprehensive manner, in accordance with Ealing`s Development Sites DPD (ACT3).

31. Construction Management and Logistics (to include all phases of the development including the related development approved under LPA ref; PP/2012/3385, shall be in accordance with the details approved under permission reference PP/2015/4570 dated 08/01/2016.
Development works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved construction logistics plan.

Reason: To protect the amenity of local residents and to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 6.3, 6.11, 6.12, 6.14, 7.14, & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(f),(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), the Council's interim guidance contained in Supplementary Planning Guidance note 10: 'Noise and Vibration' and the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise'.

32. The drainage works shall  be undertaken in accordance with the drainage strategy approved under permission reference 163173CND dated 22/12/2016. No discharge of foul or surface water from the site shall be accepted into the public system until the drainage works referred to in the strategy have been completed.

The details shall be implemented fully in accordance with the approved scheme prior to first occupation of the development unless an alternative timescale is agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that a sustainable drainage strategy is provided for the site accordance with policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(m) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 5.13 of the London Plan.

33. The noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided, and the protection of garden and balconies shall be in accordance with the details approved under permission reference 161462REM dated 22/12/2016. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained for the life of the development.

Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable traffic noise (which falls into Category C noise exposure) and also building services noise, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013.

34. Prior to the commencement of the super-structure works, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms the supply to be provided from the rear of the buildings. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied.

Reason: To safeguard the future occupiers of the development against unacceptable traffic noise (which falls into Category C noise exposure) and also building services noise, and poor air quality, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013.

35. Details for the minimum composite sound reduction indices of the building envelope and the minimum sound insulation of the building envelope elements shall be in accordance with the details approved under permission reference 161463REM dated 22/12/2016.
The measures shall be implemented as approved prior to the first occupation/use of the development and thereafter retained for the life of the development.

Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013.
36. Details for the attenuation of the external plant and machinery at the proposed premises shall be in accordance with the details approved under permission reference 161466REM dated 19/07/2016.

Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013.

37. The insulation and anti-vibration works to the floors, walls and ceiling of the retail units, forming transmission paths with the residential units above and adjacent, shall be in accordance with the details approved under permission reference 161467REM dated 19/07/2016. The approved insulation and anti-vibration measures shall be implemented before the retail use is commenced and thereafter retained for the life of the development.

Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013.
38. The details of any ventilation ducts from the commercial
